Human Rights Watch head Kenneth Roth said that Obama had clearly sided with democracy but that it was not until Zine El Abidine Ben Ali `` was basically out the door'' that France took sides. The EU, the US and others learned a lesson, he added. Western nations had long supported the Tunisian leader, seeing him as a bulwark against Islamic militants in the region. Donald Rumsfeld , who served as President Bush 's defense chief for six years after holding the same job under president Gerald Ford in the 1970s, acknowledged that in a war, many things cost lives.
